Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of education to report annually on student demographics in community school districts and high schools.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of education to report annually on student demographics in community school districts and high schools.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education to officially recognize the importance and benefits of school diversity and to set it as a priority when making decisions regarding admissions policies and practices, creation of new schools, school rezoning and other pertinent decisions and commit to having a strategy in each district for overcoming impediments to school diversity.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: DOE to officially recognize the importance and benefits of school diversity.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of education to report annually on student demographics in community school districts and high schools.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of education to report annually on student demographics in community school districts and high schools.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of education to report annually on student demographics in community school districts and high schools.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Amended by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of education to report annually on student demographics in community school districts and high schools.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education to officially recognize the importance and benefits of school diversity and to set it as a priority when making decisions regarding admissions policies and practices, creation of new schools, school rezoning and other pertinent decisions and commit to having a strategy in each district for overcoming impediments to school diversity.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: DOE to officially recognize the importance and benefits of school diversity.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of education to report annually on student demographics in community school districts and high schools.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
